document.docAuthor: Pádua, Diego G., Sääksjärvi, Ilari E., Monteiro, Ricardo F. & Oliveira, Marcio L.
document.masterDocTitle: Review of the New World genus Acrotaphus Townes, 1960 (Hymenoptera: Ichneumonidae: Pimplinae), with descriptions of fifteen new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the New World genus Acrotaphus Townes, 1960 (Hymenoptera: Ichneumonidae: Pimplinae), with descriptions of fifteen new species

bibRefCitation.author: Higa, P. T. & Penteado-Dias, A. M.
bibRefCitation.refString: Higa, P. T. & Penteado-Dias, A. M. (2019) Altitudinal effects on diversity of Pimplinae (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae) from Southeast Brazil and description of new species. Brazilian Journal of Biology, 1 - 9. [published online] https: // doi. org / 10.1590 / 1519 - 6984.210438

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Acrotaphus japi
Higa & Penteado-Dias, 2019: 5
. Holotype ♀ , Brazil (DCBU) [examined by digital image].

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. This species can be distinguished from all other
Acrotaphus
by the combination of the following characters: 1) margin of gena behind eyes strongly concave in dorsal view; 2) posterior ocelli separated from eyes by 0.1–0.2× its diameter in dorsal view; 3) body entirely reddish orange; 4) hind leg entirely reddish orange or reddish orange, with femur, tibia and tarsus blackish; 5) ovipositor straight, 1.2–1.55× as long as hind tibia.
Distribution. Argentina *, Brazil and Uruguay * ( Fig 126 ).

Biological notes. A specimen emerged from the cocoon found of the modified web of
Argiope argentata (Fabricius, 1775)
.

Material examined.
